result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary C Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 42 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons or firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign all releases for Agent.

No contact with victim D.S. UNLESS VICTIM REQUESTS CONTACT AND APPROVED BY AGENT.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Restitution hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is be held until after restitution hearing.
AMENDED 3/09/2016:  COURT ORDERS RESTITUTION AT ZERO.  BAIL TO BE REFUNDED TO POSTER.

timeConds.notes: Straight time (without work release) to commence FORTHWITH, then report to the Day Report Center for an additional 90 days.

Defendant Mary C Stevens in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  S. P. makes statements on behalf of the defendant. Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 42)
4 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No contact with victim D.S. UNESS VICTIM REQUESTS CONTACT AND APPROVED BY AGETN. 	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlleddrugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent. 
Sign all Releases for Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons or firearms.
Condition Time: 120 days JAIL WITHOUT WORK RELEASE - Then to report to the day report center for an additional 90 days.  To commence forthwith.  
Restitution: Hearing to be set.  
FINE or COSTS:  $278.00 Fine to be paid as a condition of probation. 
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation. 
BAIL IS NOT TO BE REFUNDED UNTIL AFTER THE RESTITUTION HEARING, BAIL TO BE RETAINED AT THIS TIME AND NOT USED TOWARDS COSTS.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary C Stevens in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses bail.  Poster requests cash bail be refunded.  Statements by all parties.  Court grants poster's request and orders cash bail refunded to poster.  Arguments by both parties regarding bail.  Court orders cash bail reduced to $1,000.00 along with a signature bond in the amount of $9,000.00.  Conditions to include:  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program immediately upon release from custody.  Defendant expects she may test positive for this test.  All other conditions to remain as previously set.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
